info.name: Cerebral peduncle
info.description: The cerebral peduncles are the bilateral portion of the midbrain ventral to the cerebral aqueduct. Each cerebral peduncle includes the tegmentum of the midbrain, substantia nigra plus the cerebral crus (AKA crus cerebri or basis pecunculi).  In some sources, the term 'cerebral peduncle is used interchangeably with cerebral crus and does not include the tegmentum and substantia nigra.  The interpeduncular fossa is located between the paired cerebral peduncles.
